events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover unexpected medical expenses and consolidate some existing debts.
The submitted application was reviewed and categorised under Personal Loan based on the applicant's stated use for medical bills.
Loan officer Michelle Grant was assigned to the case to assist the applicant throughout the process promptly and address any questions.
An initial review was conducted to ensure the application was complete and the purpose aligned with personal loan guidelines.
The applicant was asked to provide proof of income, recent medical bills, and identification documents to support the loan request.
All requested documents including pay stubs, medical statements, and ID copies were submitted by the applicant within the deadline.
The applicant's credit history was reviewed and showed a stable record with a few entries related to previous personal expenses.
A risk assessment was finalized considering the applicant’s credit score, debt-to-income ratio, and loan purpose for medical expenses.
A personalized loan offer with competitive interest rates and flexible payment terms was presented to the applicant for review.
The applicant responded positively to the terms and requested clarification on the repayment schedule and early payment options.
The application was escalated to the senior loan committee for further review due to the applicant requesting lower interest.
The senior loan committee approved the personal loan with slightly adjusted rates in accordance with the applicant’s feedback.
The approved loan amount was successfully disbursed into the applicant's bank account for use in medical and debt payments.
A follow-up call was conducted to ensure the applicant was satisfied with the loan and offered assistance for any further queries.
The loan application process was formally closed after successful funding and positive applicant feedback post disbursal.
